articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Delegation Back Home 
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs led by Vice-minister Kim Hyong Jun came back on Saturday after visiting China from Oct. 29.

articles.title: Delegation of DPRK Supreme Public Prosecutors Office Returns
articles.content:
Delegation of DPRK Supreme Public Prosecutors Office Returns
 Pyongyang, November 3  (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Supreme Public Prosecutors Office headed by First Vice Director Ri Chol returned home on Sunday after visiting China.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun 
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors of Japan, and his party and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Before their statues the Japanese guests paid tribute to them who made immortal contributions to accomplishing the cause of global peace and independence.
					
					 The guests entered the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state and paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 The guests made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Indonesian Delegation Various Places of DPRK
articles.content:
Indonesian Delegation Various Places of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the People's Consultative Assembly of Indonesia headed by Speaker Sidarto Danusubroto visited the e-library of Kim Il Sung University on Saturday.
					 The guests laid a bouquet before the statue of leader Kim Jong Il on the campus and paid tribute to him.
					
					 At the end of the visit to the library the head of the delegation said:
					
					 The rise and fall of a country depends on the young people. The DPRK is attaching importance to education.
					
					 This library has modern equipment.
					
					 I wish the university greater success in its education.
					
					 The delegation visited the truce village of Panmunjom on Sunday.
					
					 The guests visited the monument to President Kim Il Sung's signature. The monument conveys the feats of the President, who worked heart and soul for the reunification of the country. 
					
					 They went round the hall where the armistice talks took place, the hall where the armistice agreement was signed and Panmun Pavilion, being briefed on the fact that the army and people of the DPRK beat back the invasion by the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and won a shining victory.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum.

articles.title: Gold Prize Awarded to Korean National Food at 1st Asian Food Festival
articles.content:
Gold Prize Awarded to Korean National Food at 1st Asian Food Festival 
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Gold prize was awarded to Korean national food at the 1st Asian Food Festival held in Beijing from October 23 to 27.
					 The festival brought together 26 foodstuff processing units from 16 countries. Presented to it were at least 30 kinds of Korean national food including Sinsollo, Pyongyang Onban (cooked rice served with chicken soup) and Kimchi of Korea. 
					
					 A prize-awarding ceremony took place on October 27.

articles.title: U.S. Structure of Hegemony Has Come to End: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Structure of Hegemony Has Come to End: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. structure of hegemony has come to an end, observes Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 This is mainly attributable to its wars of aggression, military pressure, interference in internal affairs of other countries and economic sanctions, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Stupefied by strength almighty after the end of the structure of confrontation between the Soviet Union and the U.S. early in the 1990s, the U.S. stepped up its moves for modernizing weaponry and increasing armed forces while squandering a fabulous amount of military expenditure. It has worked hard to form new military alliances while pushing forward the expansion of NATO to lay a military siege to its rivals. But many countries have channeled big efforts into bolstering up military capabilities, challenging the U.S. military hegemony.
					
					 After the end of the Cold War, the U.S. waged a series of wars. A particular mention should be made of the fact that the Afghan and Iraqi wars, etc. it fought in the present century, are aimed to dominate the world. Such highhanded and arbitrary military actions of the U.S. only resulted in sparking off stronger anti-American sentiment in different parts of the world.
					
					 The U.S. strength is now waning day by day. Saddled with a huge amount of debts, it is compelled to cut down its military spending.
					
					 The U.S. is censured worldwide for spying on other countries. It has lost the capability to unilaterally manage the world market economy.
					
					 It is making desperate efforts to keep alive its ended structure of hegemony at any cost but this structure will never be restored.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules S. Korean Authorities for Keeping Mum about U.S. Wiretapping
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules S. Korean Authorities for Keeping Mum about U.S. Wiretapping 
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed that the U.S. wiretapped even the puppet president and high-ranking officials of south Korea. 
					 However, the south Korean puppet authorities keep mum about it, reading their master's face, far from reacting against the U.S. wiretapping. Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a commentary.
					
					 This self-exposes that the south Korean authorities are poor colonial servants of the U.S. as they are not in a position to utter even a word of protest against the U.S. after suffering such disgrace as wiretapping, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 The woman who claims to be "president" of south Korea suffered such insult as wiretapping but she cannot but bear it like eating boiled crow. This is the wretched plight of the puppet forces. 
					
					 This is because of the idea of submission that everything will go well, if she holds fast to the lever for maintaining power provided by the master while meeting the U.S. demands only and currying favor with it. That is why she behaves like a mute even suffering such insult. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities flatter and kowtow to the U.S. master, even bearing slaps in their faces. But they are working with bloodshot eyes to hurt fellow countrymen in the north. This is their ugly true colors as wicked traitors.
					
					 The fate of the traitors who prolong their remaining days depending on outside forces, forsaken by the country and the nation, is hanging by a thread. 
					
					 Such disgraceful behavior of the puppet group towards the U.S. master will only bring nothing but disgrace and shame.

articles.title: Conservative in S. Korea Keen on Tampering with History Urged to Step Down
articles.content:
Conservative in S. Korea Keen on Tampering with History Urged to Step Down  
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Students Committee of the Democratic Party and the Youth and Students Committee of the Justice Party of south Korea held a press conference at the "National Assembly" on Thursday demanding the resignation of the chairman of the Committee for Compiling National History who distorted the history of the nation.
					 At the press conference speakers accused the chairman of passing the screening of the textbooks complied by conservatives in such a way as to distort the history of the independence movement of the Korean nation and embellish the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 They denounced the chairman for having already called Syngman Rhee as a "savior" and insulted the national character.
					
					 He is not qualified to work at the committee as he has such biased understanding of history, they charged.
					
					 Such act can never be pardoned, they declared, urging him to apologize for his reckless acts before the people and step down at once.

articles.title: Withdrawal of Step to Stamp Out Teachers Union Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of Step to Stamp Out Teachers Union Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Members of the Teachers Union of south Korea who had been dismissed due to the unreasonable action of the puppet group held a press conference in Seoul on Wednesday demanding the withdrawal of the fascist repressive step.
					 They said that the teachers whom the authorities fired are members of the union who struggled for democracy against irregularities and corruption at schools.
					
					 They declared that if the regime does not rescind the step for stamping out the union, they would carry on their actions against the dictatorial regime.
					
					 They urged the authorities to stop the suppression of the union and force the minister of Employment and Labor and the minister of Education to step down.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Repent of Its Past
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Repent of Its Past
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- Members of south Korean civic and public organizations and organizations for the reunification movement including the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps and citizens of all social standings held the 1 098th Wednesday rally outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on October 30.
					 At the rally speakers said that more than 20 years have passed since the Wednesday rally began to settle the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army in south Korea.
					
					 Loud voices demanding Japan's apology and reparation are heard worldwide but Japan is getting frantic with the moves to revive militarism, utterly indifferent to them, they charged,
					
					 Those people who suffered from the war crimes of the Japanese imperialists are still writhing in agony, they said, demanding the Japanese government opt for apology and reparation as soon as possible.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Slams "Saenuri Party" for Covering Up Truth about Illegal Acts
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Slams "Saenuri Party" for Covering Up Truth about Illegal Acts
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Saturday carried an editorial criticizing the "Saenuri Party" for trying to cover up the truth behind the illegal interference of the Intelligence Service (IS) in the election. 
					 It said:
					
					 The parliamentary spokesman from the "Saenuri Party" on Friday alleged that the Democratic Party waged an illegal election campaign by setting in motion the Government Employees' Union (GEU) to organizationally support the opposition party's candidate during the "presidential election". 
					
					 The secretary general and other heavyweights of the ruling party joined in urging the prosecution to immediately start investigation into the campaign. 
					
					 The ruling party's moves are a typical red herring operation to cover up the truth behind the IS's interference in the election. 
					
					 What matters now is that the IS, the cyber command and other power bodies interfered in the election in an organized manner, sparking off uproar. 
					
					 A particular mention should be made of the fact that Park Geun Hye sent her special envoy to the general meeting of the GEU to congratulate it in a bid to garner votes from the government employees prior to the election last year. It is very disgusting for her to talk about illegality now. 
					
					 The call for investigation into the GEU was prompted by the ruling party's attempt to divert elsewhere public criticism of the IS's illegal acts and stamp out the progressive forces. 
					
					 The situation is becoming more complicated as Chongwadae and the ruling party are employing a poor trick to tide over their crisis.

articles.title: Lecture on French Delegation's Visit to DPRK Given in France
articles.content:
Lecture on French Delegation's Visit to DPRK Given in France
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- A lecture on the visit of the delegation of the France-Korea Friendship Association to the DPRK was given in France on Oct. 27. It visited the DPRK to take part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Displayed in its venue were photos showing the splendid celebrations of the above-said anniversaries held in the presence of supreme leader Kim Jong Un and introducing the DPRK prospering under the banner of Songun.
					
					 Present there were French public figures and masses. Staff members of the DPRK mission in Paris were present there on invitation.
					
					 Benoit Quennedey, vice-president of the association, and its general secretary said they were deeply impressed to see for themselves the DPRK making a leap forward under the leadership of Kim Jong Un during their visit.
					
					 They praised the DPRK for having firmly defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country by frustrating all the political, military and economic pressures of the U.S.-led imperialists by dint of strong military power from a principled and resolute stand.
					
					 They noted they were greatly encouraged by the energetic revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Un for building a thriving socialist nation and safeguarding peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and the Korean people's drive for bringing about miracles and innovations with each passing day under his leadership.
					
					 They reiterated their resolution to intensify the activities supporting the just cause of the Korean people.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Progressive Political Party Slammed by Regional Body
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Progressive Political Party Slammed by Regional Body 
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions released a statement on Oct. 29 in protest against the south Korean regime's suppression of the progressive political party.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The reactionary group of south Korea let the "Ministry of Justice" organize a "special team for measures against unconstitutional political parties and organizations" and is now making a legal examination of the issue of dissolving the Unified Progressive Party (UPP). After deciding to request the puppet Constitutional Court to stage a trial of the party it is inviting lawyers for the trial.
					
					 Meanwhile, the "Saenuri Party" is making much fuss, putting the issue of the UPP's disbandment as a main agenda at the "National Assembly".
					
					 It is, indeed, preposterous, sheer sophism and an unpardonable provocation to the DPRK for the "Saenuri Party" to float misinformation that the UPP "attempted a rebellion" as a "political party following the north."
					
					 The conservative group in south Korea is also working hard to disband the Teachers Union after branding it as a "center of the forces following the north" and "enemy inside south Korea". It went the lengths of scheming to shut down the progressive internet paper Jaju Minbo.
					
					 Such repressive campaign of the group is aimed to destroy the backbone of the progressive forces in south Korea, weaken all the forces aspiring after reunification through alliance with the north and democratic reforms and thus lay a springboard for ensuring its long-term stay in power. 
					
					 The prevailing situation clearly indicates that the south Korean puppet group is, indeed, a group of fascist gangsters and confrontation maniacs.
					
					 We strongly demand the group stop at once its moves to forcibly dissolve and ban the progressive political party, organization and paper.

articles.title: Historic Relics in Kaesong, DPRK Introduced by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Historic Relics in Kaesong, DPRK Introduced by Nigerian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, November 3 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article titled "Historic Relics in Kaesong, World Cultural Heritages" on its website on October 28.
					 The article recalled that UNESCO at the 37th meeting of its World Heritage Committee held in Phnom Penh, Cambodia decided to register historic relics in Kaesong, DPRK as world heritages.
					
					 It introduced in detail historic relics in Kaesong including Mausoleum of King Wang Kon, Founder of Koryo, Mausoleum of King Kongmin, Kaesong Nam Gate, Kaesong Chomsongdae (Astronomical Observatory) and Koryo Sungkyunkwan Academy which were registered as world cultural heritages.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The relics in Kaesong registered this time are of great historical and cultural value.
					
					 This was proved by the decision of the 37th meeting of the World Heritage Committee of UNESCO attended by delegates and guests from many countries.
					
					 The participants in the meeting appreciated the relics in Kaesong as marvelous and were greatly pleased with the registration of them as world cultural heritages.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre otra vez campo de esqui de monte Masik
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre otra vez campo de esqui de monte Masik
Pyongyang, 3 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, volvio a recorrer el campo de esqui del monte Masik en plena construccion.
					Ante todo, el Mariscal estuvo en el hotel que se construye con peculiaridad.
					
					Se mostro satisfecho de que los constructores militares lo acondicionan armonizando bien con el ambiente natural del  monte de acuerdo con el diseno comprobado por el partido.
					
					Lo encomio como objeto arquitectonico ejemplar en que esta materializada perfectamente la idea arquitectonica del partido de disenarlo y construirlo segun la caracteristica y uso del objeto.
					
					Acto seguido, hizo recorrido por los lugares de descanso de las pistas de categoria principiante e intermedia.
					
					Evaluo que los han construido bien de acuerdo con el proposito del partido e indico que completen perfectamente todos los lugares de descanso del campo de esqui para que los visitantes fomentaran las fuerzas fisicas y pasaran con alegria momentos de descanso.
					
					Al recorrer varias pistas de esqui ya completadas, senalo que los constructores las han explanado bien conforme a las demandas de construccion y son muy vistosas porque las cubren cespedes verdes.
					
					Ya esta a punto de culminacion la construccion del campo de esqui del monte Masik, proyectado por el partido, recalco y agrego que esto se debe absolutamente a los meritos laborales de los constructores uniformados y es un fruto orgulloso de sus proezas heroicas.
					
					Fue correcta la decision de encargar al ejercito la construccion del campo de esqui del monte Masikryong, subrayo y acoto que el EPC ha realizado una gran transformacion de la naturaleza y que la nueva palabra de epoca "Velocidad Masikryong" fue glorificada mas por el EPC.
					
					Puntualizo que para el PTC es la dignidad y orgullo tener tal ejercito.
					
					Destaco que solo en este ano el EPC ha hecho muchas cosas para el pueblo tales como la construccion del Complejo de Piscinas de Recreacion de Munsu y el Club de Equitacion de Mirim y apunto que si se inaugure el campo de esqui del monte Masikryong, resonaran mas las risas alegres del pueblo en la zona de este monte, siente orgullo de hacer la revolucion si piensa en los habitantes, jovenes y ninos escolares que pasaran tiempo alegre en el moderno campo de esqui.
					
					El Mariscal dio respuesta durante largo tiempo con mano alzada a las efusivas aclamaciones de los constructores y los elogio como patriotas diciendo que seran eternos sus meritos en la historia de construccion de la patria prospera.
					
					Por ultimo, presento las tareas y remedios que se presentan para concluir magnificamente el citado campo de esqui como lo unico en el mundo.
					
					El Mariscal fue acompanado por Choe Ryong Hae, Ryom Chol Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Tong Hwa, Hong Yong Chil, Ma Won Chun y Jo Nam Jin.
